oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Four female Marines reporting for duty
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this black and white photograph, four women in Marine uniform can be seen reporting to Lieutenant Colonel W. P. Kelly for duty at Quantico Marine Base. There is an officer handing her orders to Lt. Col. Kelly as the other three women observe. Mary Washington Frazer is the second woman from the left.

During her commission as a Marine officer, Mary Washington Frazer was stationed at Quantico Marine Base as the Assistant Adjutant General. In a letter to her brother, George Preston Frazer, Mary W. Frazer describes this photograph, explaining that she and the other officers in the photograph were the first women stationed at Quantico and several promotional photographs were taken upon their arrival. She states that the woman handing her orders to Lt. Col. Kelly is named Lt. Abbott. Frazer also mentions that a corner of her desk can be seen in the bottom corner of this photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: World War, 1939-1945; United States. Marine Corps Women's Reserve; Women and the military
Photographs; Women; Military personnel; Offices
